etymology.description: 还(還) (hái, "still; yet") is a word indicating continuation or persistence in a state or action. 是(是) (shì, "be") is a copula, used to link the subject and predicate. The combination 还是(還是) means "still" or "yet," suggesting the persistence of a state or situation despite expectations to the contrary.
etymology.interpretation: The word 还是(還是) (háishi, "still; yet") conveys the idea of something remaining unchanged or continuing in spite of circumstances that might suggest otherwise. It merges the concept of continuity from 还(還) (hái, "still; yet") with the confirming nature of 是(是) (shì, "be").

examples.chinese: 尽管外面下大雨(儘管外面下大雨)，他还是骑车上学(他還是騎車上學)。
examples.pinyin: Jǐnguǎn wàimiàn xià dàyǔ, tā háishi qíchē shàngxué.
examples.english: Although it is raining heavily outside, he still rides his bike to school.

examples.chinese: 他累了(他累了)，还是坚持工作(他還是堅持工作)。
examples.english: Even though he was tired, he still persisted in working.

examples.chinese: 时间不够了(時間不夠了)，他还是完成了任务(他還是完成了任務)。
examples.pinyin: Shíjiān bùgòule, tā háishi wánchéngle rènwù.
examples.english: Even though there wasn't enough time, he still completed the task.
